intro: Tithymalus darlingtonii, commonly known as the Darlington's tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
